p: The population of total heterotrophic bacteria (THB) ranged from 9.5 × 10 5 – 7.9 × 10 6 cfu/mL. The total heterotrophic fungi (THF) ranged from 2.1 × 10 4– 6.4 × 10 4 cfu/mL. Total viable heterotrophic indigenous (authochthonous) microbial population on CMC agar ranged from 8.2 × 10 5 – 9.1 × 10 6 cfu/mL and 1.4 × 10 3– 3.4 × 10 3 cfu/mL for bacteria and fungi respectively. The microbial population of oil degrading bacteria (ODB) ranged from 6.4 × 10 5 – 4.8 × 10 6 cfu/mL and the oil degrading fungi (ODF) ranged from 2.8 × 10 3 – 4.7 × 10 4 cfu/mL ( Tables 3 and 4). The findings revealed that ODB and ODF flourish well in oily waste water. Awotoye et al. (2011) reported THB, THF, ODF and ODB population of 1.8 × 10 6 cfu/g, 9.5 × 10 2 cfu/g, 1.2 × 10 2 cfu/g and 4.0 × 10 2 cfu/g in that order at the point of POME release from oil palm milling machine. Ugoji (1997) specified that THB and THF are 1.3 × 10 6cfu/mL and 1.0 × 10 3 cfu/mL correspondingly in POME.
